articles.description: More than twice as many people died from cancer in the U.S. last year than of Covid-19. We asked five researchers about how the pandemic has affected their vital research.
articles.content:
How has the pandemic affected cancer research?

articles.author: Nisha Mal
articles.title: Coronavirus vaccine against variant ‘could be ready within 40 days if needed’ - Wales Online
articles.description: Measures are in place to produce the “next iteration” of jabs if needed, a minister says
articles.content:
A new coronavirus jab could be manufactured within just 30 to 40 days if a variant of the virus is found to be less responsive to the vaccines available, according to a minister.
